alto:TextBlock.alto:String: NEWS ‘She’s such a builder:’ Kauanui appointed to Indigenous Studies professorship The Effron Center for the Study of America is located in Morrison Hall. Candace Do / The Daily Princetonian Listen to this article In the Native Hawaiian culture, t ī leaf leis are a symbol of protection and welcome. One of these leis was gifted to professor J. K ē haulani Kauanui by Ila Nako ’26, a student leader in Natives at Princeton (NAP), and two other Native Hawaiian students when the anthropologist visited campus last October. During her visit, Kauanui, a Native Hawaiian who teaches at Wesleyan University, gave a talk on Hawaiian decolonization and feminism. Coming this summer, she will assume the Eric and Wendy Schmidt Professor of Indigenous Studies position at Princeton. Elisabeth Stewart April 10, 2024 | 11:49pm EDT https://www.dailyprincetonian.com/article/2024/04/princeton-news-adpol-indigenous-studies-native-american-effron-center-hire 1/3
